modules.description: The module provides a typed interface for constructing semantic and structural HTML elements, including headers, forms, and inline components, with specialized handling of attributes where some accumulate (like class) and others override. It supports both void elements (e.g., meta, script) and container elements (e.g., div, nav), enabling precise control over document structure and content through tag-specific constructors and child node composition. This facilitates tasks like creating dynamic web interfaces and ensuring consistent HTML formatting with semantic clarity.

Tracks dynamic values that update in response to events, supporting reactive updates through a system of dependent computations. It operates on streams and signals, enabling real-time data flow management. Used to create interactive terminal interfaces by synchronizing user input with visual output.

provides a system for building structured, semantically rich HTML documents through tag-specific constructors that manage attribute accumulation and overriding, supporting both void and container elements. It defines a core data type for HTML nodes, with operations for composing children, setting attributes, and rendering elements. Users can create dynamic interfaces by combining elements like headers, forms, and scripts, while maintaining control over class names and other attributes. Examples include generating responsive layouts, embedding scripts conditionally, and constructing form elements with validated input fields.
